#summary Setting up your project to use the JGit Maven 2 repository
#labels Featured

= Configuring Maven =

Snapshots of JGit are available via the Google Code project area for use in [http://maven.apache.org/ Maven 2] projects. The update policy is to synchronize the snapshots a few times a month depending on the number of changes and whether notable changes have been made.

To use the snapshot repository from your Maven project, add the following element to the `<repositories>` section of either your pom.xml or settings.xml:
{{{
<repository>
    <id>jgit-snapshot-repository</id>
    <url>http://egit.googlecode.com/svn/maven/snapshot-repository/</url>
</repository>
}}}

Then add the element below to the `<dependencies>` section of your pom.xml:
{{{
<dependency>
    <groupId>org.spearce</groupId>
    <artifactId>jgit</artifactId>
    <version>0.4-SNAPSHOT</version>
</dependency>
}}}
